data.message: Just leave my news feed alone, stop putting me into top stories!

replies.message: Hey Jeff. We've invested a lot to understand how News Feed can show the most engaging content to the majority of people. Top Stories is the result of our findings, which is why it is the default. We know that some people prefer the Most Recent view, so we've kept this option available. If you have specific thoughts you want to share, please let us know here: http://on.fb.me/1rmVirO -Hailey
Yeah, and you keep burrying "Most Recents" button, especially last upgrade on the iPad. And it's not an option when you keep forcing us into it.
Also not an option on mobile app

Why can't we get the most recent settings on the fb app on our phone apps. It sure would be better than reading the same posts over & over. This is this only way I & a lot of people get on fb. You miss so many post when it is on top stories.
Roger Brown..........mobile apps have a view most recent.......it's located at the bottom of the screen under MORE. Scroll down and you will see it!
Stop wasting your money on crap like this and make it useful. Do a simple update that changes it. You guys are rich for crying out loud. Especially those Facebook games
